test.question: Understanding the ________ that separate us from each other can also enable us to ________ the complex fabric of our society.
What is most needed in a discussion of immigration are solid facts, not wishful thinking; realities, not ________.
South Korea's industrial production fell 6 percent last year, the largest annual ________ since 1980, fueling fears that the ________ economy is slipping deeper into recession.

By gradually winning the support of both liberals and conservatives, both rich and poor, the governor has demonstrated that her remarkable________ skills go side by side with her willingness to speak openly and ________ on controversial issues.
Slander and libel laws stand as a protection of an individual's reputation against the ________ dissemination of falsehoods.
Presenting love as foolish, compromised, or dangerous, his love songs are frankly ________.
By showing that the trainer's voice ________ gave commands to the horse, he was able to ________ the clever ruse which contended that an animal could add and subtract.
For an actor so changeable and unpredictable, even the word ________ seems inadequate.
A ________ is distrustful of human goodness and sincerity, and a ________ has a hatred of people in general.
With the benefit of ________, it is easy to see the mistakes we made last week or last year.
The pamphlet argues that imagination is not a gift ________ to poets, but something everyone possesses.
That 'less is more' is a(n) ________upon which all of the governor's conservation program is based.
Though McCarthy tried to provoke a ________, Eisenhower ignored all the senator's ________ as if he had not heard them.
Again and again, out of indifference or sheer stupidity, we have ________ our resources, assuming that there was no end to the earth's ________ to recover from our mistakes.
Despite ________ reports of freewheeling spending on political candidates by large corporations, most business contributions are ________divided between the two major parties.
With characteristic understatement, Webster called his client's embezzlement of 4 million dollars a regretted ________.
Keynes's theory that unemployment is caused by a(n) ________ disposition to save cannot explain the high unemployment in ________ countries that have no savings at all.
His biographer believed that Pierce's ________ was caused by his ________ to travel and his refusal to read about any position different from his own.
Though she was ________ by the medical establishment, Dr. Sandstrom bravely continued her work until other doctors could no longer deny the ________ of her theories.
